svg.text: Earn XP Use Case
Use Case Specification
Use Case Name:
Earn XP
Actor(s):
Regular User, System
Description:
Automatic experience point calculation and awarding system for user activities
including hosting matches, joining matches, achievements, and social interactions.
Preconditions:
1. User must be logged in and perform XP-eligible activities
Main Flow:
1. User performs XP-eligible activity (hosting, joining, achieving)
2. System detects activity completion and validates eligibility
3. System calculates XP amount based on activity type and difficulty
4. XP Sources: Hosting match (+50 XP), Joining match (+25 XP)
5. Achievement unlocks provide variable XP (10-100 XP based on difficulty)
6. Social activities: Friend connections (+5 XP), Profile completion (+20 XP)
7. System adds XP to user's total and updates progress tracking
8. System checks for tier advancement (Bronze→Silver→Gold→Platinum→Diamond)
9. System displays XP gain notification with activity description
10. System updates leaderboard rankings and user profile display
11. XP progress bar updates showing advancement toward next tier
Alternative Flows:
A1. Tier advancement: User reaches new tier, system displays promotion celebration
A2. Achievement unlock: XP gain triggers new achievement, additional XP awarded
A3. Bonus XP events: System applies multipliers during special events
A4. XP penalties: Negative XP for cancellations or inappropriate behavior
A5. Daily limits: System caps daily XP gains to prevent exploitation
A6. Retroactive XP: System awards XP for past activities during system updates
